p: It is worth comparing RCM-based simulations in Figs 3, 4 with projections based on GCMs. Figure 5 shows the MMM of HW metrics from GCM simulations over the base period 1961–1990 (1 st row), as well as the MMM of HW metrics and of TX95 estimates from GCM simulations over the period 2046–2055 under the RCP4.5 scenario (2 nd row). Figure 5 also shows the change, 1961–1990 to 2046–2055 (RCP4.5), in TX95 estimates and in the HW metrics from GCM simulations (3 rd row). Figure 6 shows the MMM of the TX95 estimates and of the HW metrics from GCM simulations over the period to 2091–2100 under the RCP4.5 scenario (1 st row), as well as the change, 1961–1990 to 2091–2100 (RCP4.5), in TX95 estimates and in the HW metrics from GCM simulations (2 nd row).
